website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive organic wool dryer balls that work well for most, but also come with issues common to this type of product.
pros: Lots of user-friendly features for an affordable price – pack of 6, large size, and all-natural New Zealand wool
cons: Won't work at reducing static and drying times on all types of laundry
Rare complaints of a strange smell that may fade over time

customer_reviews.title: Disturbed by the mold 5/6/18
customer_reviews.text: These arrived to me today covered in mold. MOLD! Why were they even mailed to me in this state? I’m extremely allergic and appalled that the black fuzz and dots totally covering the bottom of the bag didn’t clue someone into not mailing them. Now I get to bother with sending them back. What a waste of my time. I’m disgusted.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: not filled with chemicals and a good value assuming they do hold up for 1000 loads
customer_reviews.text: We decided to stop using dryer sheets and give these a try. We haven’t experienced any noticeable reduction in drying time. Our laundry also has a bit more static than it used to - we went from almost none, to a smidge - i.e. not ruining our lives. All that being said, the fact that these are sustainable, not filled with chemicals and a good value assuming they do hold up for 1000 loads, were going to stick with them.
customer_reviews.author: RAL

customer_reviews.title: No chemicals and they work, Yea
customer_reviews.text: Using dryer sheets and clothes softener destroyed the sensor in my dryer and after costly repairs to replace the sensor I went looking for alternatives. I saw the Wool Dryer Balls that can do the same thing as as the sheets ans liquids with chemicals. I put the balls in the dryer and crossed my fingers. The clothes turned out great. I found I can even add my own favorite sent or essential oil to them. I am very pleased. I really do not like ironing so this works is a good alternative to chemicals. And they are reusable, Yea
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement to Expensive Dryer Sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these dryer balls. I used them to replace my dryer sheets and get rid of all the toxins I was putting all over my clothes. They also decrease the drying time in my dryer and make my clothes so soft and fluffy. If I need extra static help, I just put a safety pin on a ball. I have recommended these to all my friends as well!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: I don't miss my fabric softener at all!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to fabric softener, Product is well made and does what it claims, You do still get a small amount of static, but mostly on man made fabrics like polyester, blends, etc. The clothes come out soft, though not quite as soft as with fabric softener. Dryer time is shortened by 10 to 20 %. Also notice that towels seem to be more absorbent. Great money saver, and a gift to those with allergies to the chemicals in fabric softener.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Believe the Hype
customer_reviews.text: Yep, these work every bit as well as is claimed. My clothes dry faster and, most importantly to me, with SO MUCH LESS STATIC! I haven't even tried the safety-pin trick yet (probably I'll resort to that when winter rolls around with its dry air, but so far the balls on their own are enough). I think my clothes come out softer, too, but that could just be a side-effect of the lack of hated static making them seem softer; in the end is there really a difference? Anyway, the point is: these are so worth it. I regret every load of laundry I ever put in the dryer before them.
customer_reviews.author: Rhys

customer_reviews.title: The wool dryer balls are amazing@
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of difficulty with a clothes dryer that took too long to dry and also got the bedsheets rolled into one another. I bought the balls mainly to avoid using fabric softeners (because of the negative impact on the environment), but I find that clothes dry faster, more evenly and are far less wrinkled than before! My daughter has also bought them for her dryer and loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Hatshepsut

customer_reviews.title: Does horrible things with pet fur.
customer_reviews.text: I have both cats and dogs and their fur/hair inevitably gets into things that need to be laundered. I used to use the plastic dryer balls which worked fine, but after 6 years they got brittle and started to fall apart, so I tried these. Big mistake. They cause the fur and hair to pill up into nasty little (really little) balls that cling to everything, and also cause just enough static to cover the inside of the dryer. These are not worth buying, at any cost.
customer_reviews.author: Marta Randall

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I originally found them in a granola mom shop for $30. Obviously they ordered them from Amazon and hiked them up. They do really hold up well. You can wash them in the washer with your clothes if they get dirty and throw them in the dryer. If you like your clothes with fabric softener, just add an essential oil you like. Peppermint/orange/lavender combo or on their own make your clothes smell fresh and not like you’re a hippie. Remember folks, patchouli doesn’t help anyone make friends. Don’t add that to these dryer balls...or anything else in your life.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Love these wool dryer balls!
customer_reviews.text: These dryer balls are perfect! I love the fact that they are natural and I can add a few drops of essential oils to them for chemical free scent. Was going to make my own, but after doung the math on a few skeens of natural wool yarn, it came out much cheaper to get them already made. They are a nice size and uniform in shape. Dryer time did seem to be reduced by just a bit. Static was reduced as well. Would purchase again when they wear out, but I have a feeling these will last a long time. May get some to use as gifts:)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S

customer_reviews.title: Choose natural over chemicals
customer_reviews.text: I started using these dryer balls after reading about them from a cleaning blog I follow. I really like them. I do find my clothes dry faster. I actually just throw all of them in the dryer together. I know the package says to use a couple. I find the more the better! Lol And I like adding my essential oils to them. I no longer use fabric sheets. I'm all for going more natural and ditching all the chemicals! Its just better for yourself and family. I will definitely buy more when mine wear out!
customer_reviews.author: just browsing

customer_reviews.title: They really do help with our laundry.
customer_reviews.text: These balls really cut down on our dry time. I was drying, on medium, for 50 minutes + each load. Now, on low, things dry around the same time or a few minutes earlier. I can hear them bouncing around, but I don't mind as I know it keeps the clothes from bunching up, and aids with the drying. I could see how someone might get annoyed with it but I wasn't. I still use a dryer sheet with them, to further reduce static, and because I like the smell. Haven't tried any essential oils on them yet but have thought about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a great product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 dryer balls from a different outfit in 2017, I think, or about the same price. They are still working but I decided I wanted more. These 6 balls arrived in a very handy bag, large enough to easily hold all 6 between uses. I find my clothing comes out of the dryer almost wrinkle free and needing just a bit of hand smoothing for most things. My towels come out soft and without the 'dryer sheet' or softener coating that makes them less absorbent.
customer_reviews.author: sstj Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Time and money saving product!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I have a bad habit of over filling the washer to avoid multiple loads. The result is a large load that takes almost 2 full drying cycles to dry but now that I add the dryer balls to the large load it drys in one run. Saving time and money! Greatly reduces static cling without the harsh chemicals. They kept my clothes from tangling and cut my drying time. They didn't make any loud knocking noise while in the dryer. And my clothes felt softer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn S Boggs

customer_reviews.title: Clothes dry faster and are nice and super soft and it beats the wrinkles out ...
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these a hundred years ago! Clothes dry faster and are nice and super soft and it beats the wrinkles out of everything so if you grab your clothes the second the dryer stops everything look like you ironed it. I have heard other smell badly but these did not. I washed them just to make sure but they were perfect to start. You will chase them around the floor as you pull your clothes out but well worth the effort. Put at least 6 or more in. You will save on power with these so they easily pay for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for every drying load and they are wonderful! No more static and no more harsh chemicals! I feel safe using them with my toddler's clothes too! For mine, I add some lavender essential oil and it makes the clothes smell wonderful. I was a little worried about the lavender oil getting onto my clothes but the wool drying balls soak it in very nicely and it has not been an issue. An added plus is storing the wool dryer balls in my closet (they come with a cloth bag) between laundry uses makes my closet/room smell great too!
customer_reviews.author: Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Added prickly fibers into our clothes, literal pin pricks from the fibers led to annoying rashes
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months, we started getting weird prickly feelings in especially our tighter clothes, like socks and jeans. Then. The rashes came, not from a wool allergy, but from what we realized was from being constantly pricked by wool fibers embedded in ALL of our clothes. Hopefully they wash back out, I worry they won't, that would mean replacing pretty much all of our clothes! Might be an expensive lesson, time will tell if they wash back out
customer_reviews.author: R.A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and no petting zoo scent!
customer_reviews.text: We're expecting a baby in just a couple of weeks and I wanted an alternative to dryer sheets for all of our clothes. These seemed like a good deal for the price and number of balls so I was a little worried they'd show up and smell "of the pasture." I'm happy to report that they did not smell anything like a sheep! I put a few drops of lavender oil on them and clothes really do come out wrinkle free and smelling better than they did with dryer sheets. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Heather N.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME, efective
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about this product but... wow... they really DO work. Our clothes and towels come out of the drier softer than before when we used fabric softener sheets, and the drier cycle time is about 7 minutes shorter. And when drying big heavy items like a load of bath towels, blankets, rugs etc, the drying time is cut in half. I think it must have something to do with the balls allowing better airflow?? Bottom line, they work!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with these dryer balls! They smelled a little when I first took them out of the pack but I let them air out for a bit and then they were fine. I don't know if they help dry things any quicker but they do reduce static. We live in Arizona were everything is dry and there is alway static, everywhere. These balls do the trick just as well as any dryer sheet I have ever used and I love that they are eco friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Kiel Munger

customer_reviews.title: Creates a lot of static, deposits lint onto your clothes
customer_reviews.text: I trusted the reviews for this product and that was obviously a mistake. Wool is known to create static and contrary to the manufacturers claim that these remove static, they actually CREATE STATIC. The other thing they do is grab lint from some clothes and deposit it onto other clothes. Not what you're looking for. (see pics). Very disappointed and these are apparently non-returnable. Funny it didn't say that when I ordered them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money! Your clothes will still have static!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these dryer balls with the intent of using them to dry baby clothing and linens. Not only were the clothes staticky, but often times still damp as well. The product claims are inaccurate and I advise you to not waste your money on these!
customer_reviews.author: WillsReviews

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it promising and cut my drying time in half!. I live in an apartment with a VERY old dryer. At times for a full load of laundry it could take up to 3-4 runs to get the clothes completely dry. I was desperate since the complex wouldn't replace the dryer and decided to try these. I am SOOOO HAPPY I did! Now it takes 1-1 1/2 runs. I absolutely love them they've not only made my clothes and blankets softer, but saved me time and money on my electric bill!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got these!
customer_reviews.text: I had been curious about these for awhile. Then I washed an entire load of clothes with a box of dryer sheets--box and all. I should know better than to put the dryer sheets on top of my stacking washer dryer. But this left me without dryer sheets and I had an excuse to give these a shot. I haven't put any essential oils on them, so basically the only thing I miss is the dryer sheet smell. The big upside is that these are environmentally friendly and my clothes seem to dry a bit faster too.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Alexander

customer_reviews.title: They Are Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best Dryer Balls I have ever used. They actually redistribute the smell of whatever fragrant oil I use throughout the load. The clothes smell WONDERFUL. Better than a dryer sheet, better than softener and I have used tons. I use one dryer sheet just for static and the dryer balls for fragrance. I am amazed at how well they are performing. I am so glad I stumbled upon these. I'll have to guard these with my life as my furry grandchildren loves to confiscate them every time one falls out! lol
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Did not help at all with static and after 1 use they pilled up really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L.

customer_reviews.title: These don't work for me
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended wool dryer balls. I try to be environmentally friendly, so I purchased these. I can't tell that they do anything except make noise. Instead of making my sheets soft, the sheets looked like they had been beaten on a washboard. I have used 2, 3, 4, and 5 balls at the same time. Nothing feels soft like it does with washer fabric softener.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful Nana

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I put all 6 balls in my dryer (regular size dryer , not an extra large capacity one). The drying time was NOT reduced and the static and clinging was as bad as not having anything at all. The balls do not take the functional place of a dryer sheet. I must find sheets that are not toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Ilana Egner

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Dry the green way!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative to dryer sheets- and its green! Not toxic fumes or off gassing of the chemicals on dryer sheets. This fluffs my big duvet and it help the clothes to dry faster. These are the XL size which fit in my hand a little bigger than a tennis ball. And I only use two or three at a time. This is an excellent price for the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but not a perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of these dryer balls, and I also love that they eliminate the waste of dryer sheets. However, my clothes still get quite static-y at times. I have tried everything I can think of to add to the dryer balls, but sometimes I still throw a dryer sheet in to prevent the static. I still like these, and I love that you can use essential oils on them for fragrance. Despite not being exactly what I though, they have still cut down on my use of dryer sheets, so I consider that a win! They are not loud in my dryer either, which I was worried about.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Maddamma

customer_reviews.title: A lot of Static
customer_reviews.text: I have been using wool dryer balls for years. I just figured one wool dryer ball from New Zealand was as good as another.so I bought this brand and received them a month ago and noticed some of the balls were changing shape which was not a bad thing I guess but then rather quickly, I noticed that my load was full of static. I have never had that problem before with any of the dryer balls in the past. So, after 1 mo. I tried to send them back but they were not returnable so I am stuck.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Really?
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully, your balls are working better than the ones I was sent, because I can't see any difference in drying time or wrinkles, and we have an Airbnb and we do a lot of wash (sheets and towels in addition to regular laundry.) I got a second brand of these as well, they look identical and only difference was the price. Neither decreased drying time wrinkles, but the cat does like playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item due to reviews but it made no difference on my dry clothes. I did not notice less wrinkles, less drying time, or less static.
customer_reviews.author: prncez1921

customer_reviews.title: Work surprisingly well!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been skeptical about dryer balls and recently bought some of the plastic ones which worked fairly well. However, one of the balls imploded, so I figured I would look at the wool ones. Anyway, I am just surprised by how well these things work! No static cling, soft clothes, etc.. I was skeptical about the claim that they reduce drying time, but I seriously think they do!
customer_reviews.author: Alison M.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped using these and made our own. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We bought them to replace dryer sheets that we are allergic to. Not sure if they are actually 100% wool, as our essential oils do not stay longer than one dryer load. We are using high end oils, so we know it is not that. We have stopped using these and ended up making our own wool balls and they are SO MUCH BETTER. The smell lasts so much longer and they just work better overall. Would recommend making your own over wasting money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Arndt

customer_reviews.title: Makes static cling worse
customer_reviews.text: I went with the wool over the plastic balls due to a review of the plastic balls that said there was a plastic smell from using them. The wool ones actually seem to make my laundry more static filled than if I used nothing at all, and it isn't because I am over drying the clothes as the package suggests may happen. Will be buying some plastic ones instead.
customer_reviews.author: CLL

customer_reviews.title: Not particularly effective
customer_reviews.text: These help some but overall I'm disappointed. I am trying hard to get away from the nasty chemicals and waxy build-up in commercial fabric softeners of all kinds. These are not a perfect replacement. They help "some" but I'm getting complaints that bath towels are scratchy etc. I'm sure these are fine quality for type, but I don't find them to be nearly as effective as regular dryer sheets or liquid softener. However, I won't go back after doing the research on commercial softeners. I will do more research perhaps in the use of baking soda or vinegar or other such ideas. These balls seem right now to be only a part of my solution.
customer_reviews.author: David AndersonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' these balls
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, I had plastic ones and liked them for what they did, but they were plastic........they broke down and I threw them away and never got any others. These were appealing and very reasonably priced, so I decided to give them a try. They are wonderful. I love the feel of them, and even better, they work even better than the plastic ones. I have done 4 loads of different kinds of laundry and they work great. My clothes come out wrinkle free and dry in less time. I am allergic to scent, so I appreciate that they are fragrance free. Laundry seems nice and fresh after using these.
customer_reviews.author: Pamm Mosey

customer_reviews.title: Do not work.
customer_reviews.text: These did not work for me. I did three loads of laundry this weekend. My dryer has an automatic shut off when the laundry is done. Every single load I took out of the dryer was staticky. I had to throw each load back into the dryer with dryer sheets. I'm incredibly disappointed in these. Will not buy again, nor tell anyone I know to use them. They do not work.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Eliminate Static Cling.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes, but I still get static cling after drying. I've tried 2, 3, and 4 balls and have adjusted dry time and temp to no avail. UPDATE 10/26/2018 Updating rating from 3 to 4 stars. Why? Seems the more you use the balls the better they work! Weird, but true. Now that the balls are a bit weathered, they really do keep static cling at bay.
customer_reviews.author: WickedQueen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: As a mom who uses cloth diapers, I don’t use fabric softener as it can affect the diapers. I also don’t use scented products because I’m asthmatic. I had bought reusable dryer balls years ago...they’ve seen better days. I’d never tried wool before, but decided to replace my worn out dryer balls with these. I am so happy I did! I was surprised by their size; they’re larger than the ones I’ve had. We’ve had no issues with static, and I use them to cut down on drying time, which I hope these do!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: No noticeable improvement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these wool dryer balls specifically for towels since fabric softener makes them less absorbent. I was hoping this would work since they are highly reviewed, but I did not notice any improvement after using them, I placed all 6 balls in the dryer and my towels came out feeling exactly the same as before. these are not the solution I was hoping for and I am somewhat disappointed. The wool dryer balls seem to be made of excellent quality, they were just ineffective. ** If you found this review to be helpful at all, please take a moment and click the button below to let Amazon know. Thank you so much 😊 **
customer_reviews.author: 🤗Ovrjoyd🤗

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to leave bad reviews. I generally only write reviews when I have something positive to say. But I have used other dryer balls that did the job and worked for about 1,000 loads before static returned. I can't remember that brand and with mostly at home shopping these days, I looked on Amazon and picked these from many that were listed. From the first time we used them, they just didn't remove the static, which is their main purpose. Since I got rid of the packaging, I can't return them and will just have to try again. I would give these zero stars if I could because they just didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Annette  C.

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely convinced...
customer_reviews.text: Been using these with all my laundry, but they don't seem to be doing much, or at least not as much as the descriptions tout them to do. With my clothes I really don't notice anything, and with my bedding my blankets do seem a bit fluffier and my pillowcases less wrinkled, but that's about it. Didn't notice a difference with drying time. I definitely can't see these replacing dryer sheets for me. Everything is still full of lint and static, they don't do anything for the smell unless you specifically add oil, and clothes in particular stay wrinkly. But I'll probably keep using them with my blankets and such.
customer_reviews.author: Kia

customer_reviews.title: Work very well for me
customer_reviews.text: They to help reduce wrinkles and aid in more even drying when the load has some different weight items. I have not noticed any unusual odor from them, nor any shedding. I did put a little essential oil on one ball and it scents the load nicely. A different essential oil I tried did not work. Same brand, different scent. So it may be that some scents work better for this application than others. I don't mind the thumping of the balls in the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne L.

customer_reviews.title: Great if you follow directions
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I haven't used any essential oils, but I have very sensitive skin and I wanted something natural. At first my clothes were very staticky, but then I read the description again and realized I wasn't using the right number of dryer balls. I do have to be really careful when folding my clothes- my dog thinks these are great toys! Now I remove them as I take my clothes out of the dryer instead of tossing them in my basket with my clean clothes.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Dryer Sheets Worked Better
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to like these so we could give up dryer sheets. Our clothes are taking much longer to dry, they’re unbelievably static-y and no matter how much essential oils I put on them, there is no scent transfered to the clothes. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Morton

customer_reviews.title: On my third batch!
customer_reviews.text: I started ysing dryer balls tenish years ago snd have never looked back! These are fantastic. I live in FL and am always looking to keep the house cooler and using dryer balls has absolutely cut down my dry time per load. Plus no static! When I want a scent I add a few drops of esstential oils directly on a ball. Most loads I use three. When they start to get mushy, I give them to the dog. Win win.
customer_reviews.author: Katie & Tyler's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a better deal for 6 wool dryer balls anywhere. The clothes that would normally wrinkle with my old hard nubby dryer balls actually came out beautifully wrinkle-free and fresh smelling with no static. The SnugPad balls left no lint or unusual smell. I'm using only 3 and keeping the others tucked away because my husband has a habit of losing them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolee888

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: No scent unless you add. Does not help with wrinkles. Does make clothes softer. Have to use all 6 though or it won't be a good experience. I tried 4 last weekend, no good. I like them more than dryer sheets feel less chemicaly in my clothes. Sounds odd maybe but dryer sheets always left the dry bar soap feel after on clothes so wool balls is a good alternative. I knew tennis balls worked with sheets/blankets (something learned from laundry attendants) but this was my first trials with wool balls as a replacement for dryer sheets. Good start. Just use all 6 or 8 balls.
customer_reviews.author: DWarlord

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: These balls have done nothing to shorten my drying time,soften my clothes, or prevent any kind of wrinkling. There was no smell on them and the cost was great but this did not make up for the fact that they didn't really do their job. I dont reccomend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Matthews

customer_reviews.title: I Buy Them for Myself and Friends and Family
customer_reviews.text: I have lost count on how many of these I have bought! First for me,then gifts for family and friends. And for the simple reason:THEY WORK! My 6 little wool balls live comfortably in my dryer at all times,ready to bounce and fluff when I need them! I always tell skeptics to get 2 identical towels straight from the washer and dry one without the balls,keeping track of the time. Then dry the other,WITH the balls. I guarantee the time with the balls will be shorter,saving your electricity,and also saving on the softener and dryer sheets you no longer need to buy.
customer_reviews.author: LA Aikin

customer_reviews.title: Eco-friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these for my mom and she loved them. I bought a set for myself because I want to reduce my exposure to chemicals, reduce landfill waste, and save money. I've done several loads ans am not dissapointed. Towels, sweaters and clothes came out wrinkle free and static free. There was one pair of lounge-wear that was a little staticky, but I think it's just that kind of fabric. I added some essential oil drops to them yesterday and it gave off a lovely smell that was not overpowering. I'm going to buy a set for all my friends for the holidays.
customer_reviews.author: ultcyn

customer_reviews.title: Still going great!
customer_reviews.text: So far, been through about 10 dry cycles with no problems! I used a couple of drops (6-9 drops or so per ball) of lavender essential oil and everything comes out smelling great! Everything comes out dry and nice, so no complaints! No real static problems for me yet or things falling apart. It doesn't really shorten my dry cycle from what I can tell, but they work! Edit: So it's been over 7 months since I purchased these, and I still think they're freakin' amazing! They're holding up just fine, and still do a fantastic job! I definitely will be purchasing them again if/when they need replacing. Definitely worth giving them a shot, if you haven't.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B

customer_reviews.title: works great for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought two different kinds of these dryer balls. My daughter uses them in place of liquid fabric softener and dryer sheets. I was skeptical but they do work. Since they are re-usable, the cost of these instead of other methods doesn't compare. The only thing I noticed is when using them to dry sheets or blankets is they tend to get tangled up and end up in the corners of fitted sheets. My washer and dryer are in the basement and I don't want the balls rolling around down there, so it is a little inconvenient having to get them out of the sheets.
customer_reviews.author: mab

customer_reviews.title: LINT CITY
customer_reviews.text: I don't get it! I wanted to like these. I'm slowly trying to be more waste-conscious and energy efficient, and thought these would be up my alley. They made all of my clothes covered with lint! I don't even care if they minimally decreased the dryer time, I had to re-wash everything. Gross.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie

customer_reviews.title: What are you buying for?
customer_reviews.text: I would return these but it’s not allowed... does not release wrinkles, soften or decreases drying time and I have noticed a lot of static cling. Did make clothes smell good though
customer_reviews.author: Shyla

customer_reviews.title: Only received 7 dryer balls, supposed to be 8
customer_reviews.text: The wool dryer balls are fine, but there's supposed to be a pack of 8. When my package arrived I opened the box to find that the plastic bag containing the dryer balls was ripped at the bottom and I was missing a ball. I only received 7. It's entirely too inconvenient and a huge hassle to have to mail them back just to get one ball replaced, so I just dealt with it, but I will not be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Increased static
customer_reviews.text: While these definitely reduced drying time and wrinkles they did seem to create lots of static. More static with the balls then with nothing in with clothing. Returning them as they did not perform the way I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Guisbert

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$!
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised that they actually do work as described. Definately less drying time on most loads. Larger loads not much of a difference but average and smaller loads noticeably shorter dry time. Assuming it's because the balls can move more freely. And do somewhat notice less wrinkling but hard to say for sure. I always remove clothes immediately when done and iron while still warm. I do like that I dont use dryer sheets any more. And I have also noticed a big decrease in the amount of lint in the trap. Will definately be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: tommyb

customer_reviews.title: Leaves wool hairs on everything
customer_reviews.text: I only used the wool balls a of times and they’re already garbage. They left the hairs from the wool all over everything.
customer_reviews.author: A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so that I could stop using fabric softener (liquid and dryer sheets). These do not help at all with softness, static or anything really.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Carter

customer_reviews.title: No Wrinkles with these Dryer Balls
customer_reviews.text: I saw these in a friend's dryer and had no idea what they were. When I heard these "dryer balls" kept wrinkles out of the clothes and stopped static, I ordered the 6 pack. I am not one to be standing by the dryer when the cycle finishes, so my clothes were wrinkled and I had to run them again, just enough to get them smoother. This dryer balls are incredible. Whenever, I go get the clothes out of the dryer, no wrinkles! There is still static but no wrinkles is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: B Tatum

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I am definitely trying to be more Echo friendly and have decided to try these. I have very sensitive skin and have to use baby detergent for all my laundry. When I cam across these, I decided to try them out and absolutely fell in love! Not only that there are no chemicals and no scent to this product, my laundry had to static and not lint! I do recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Household must have
customer_reviews.text: I have not used these yet, but I am so excited to. I love them already and I haven't taken them out of the package! I bought these to assist with fluffing up my pillows in the dryer once a week since my pillows go flat pretty often. I bought these in particular because for the size and the quantity the price was more than fair. I used to see these dryer balls in Marshalls and T.J. Maxx all the time but the amount you get for the price always turned me away. Keep the price and the quantity the same and I will definitely be back for more!
customer_reviews.author: Soledad

customer_reviews.title: Sheds all over my clothes.
customer_reviews.text: This product works good for about two loads and then it seems to not work anymore. I have found that they “shed” leaving little hairs all over my clothes. There is no scent to them and they do not have any freshness to them either. They do more bad than good in my opinion. Not worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to dryer sheets
customer_reviews.text: These definitely help dry laundry faster, but don't quite take away all the static. I have to use all 6, and then if it is a large load, there is still a little static on some of the items. They make a little thumping noise, but nothing too loud like a pair of shoes does. I like the fact of getting away from chemicals, so I might have to purchase more to help with the static in larger loads of laundry.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: if I am moving fast I misplace my balls
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this product !! I am making my way to a more sustainable lifestyle a d this transition was easy !! I was not aware of the XL size and felt it might be excessive but No, trust me its exactly what you need. As it stands I unload the dryer and if I am moving fast I misplace my balls and if it wasnt for its size I wouldnt be able to find them. Next piece of advice, sprinkle essential oil fragrance for a customizable scent to your fabric. There is advice to recharge your wool balls but I have not gotten there yet
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Harley

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical but now a believer, they work!
customer_reviews.text: I've done about 15 loads of laundry since purchasing these just to do some "testing" and so far, I've been pleasantly surprised. These wool balls have cut down on dry time by about 10-15 minutes per load. Best part, I've done loads of bath towels and bed sheets, no more knotted up, dry here but not there spots. No static either. Nice size too, I'd say slightly larger than a tennis ball. I was skeptical but they do what they say they'll do. Overall would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: busymomPA

customer_reviews.title: Can use with essential oils. Doesn't eliminate static.
customer_reviews.text: They are fun and I like putting oils on them, but they don't really do much for static like I thought they would. Great for scenting your laundry, though, by dropping essential oils on them. (And fun to throw at your partner or pets when they're not looking as they are large and harmless.)
customer_reviews.author: Nichole B

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I put 2 of these in my dryer and my clothes have never been so wrinkled. This actually caused my clothes to wrinkle. It did not shorten dry time or reduce wrinkles. I regret buying these
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! The 6 wool dryer balls arrived packaged in a cotton drawstring storage bag. I am using 4 of the dryer balls per dryer load. Since I started using them, I find there is still some cat hair left on the clothes after they are washed and dried, but it seems to be easier to pick it off the dry clothes now compared to before. The clothes also seem to be a bit "fresher" after they are dried with the dryer balls. As long as they hold up, I am happy and the price was great.
customer_reviews.author: ard78641

customer_reviews.title: The best in line!
customer_reviews.text: This is the highest quality Wool Dryer Balls I ever bought. Much better than other brands sold online. It absorbs moisture from my clothes faster and does not shed. I have sensitive skin, dryer sheets always make my skin itchy. These balls solved the problem. I'm very happy with them! The seller is very quick to ship them. It only took 2 days even I don't have Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Tao Zheng

customer_reviews.title: These do nothing!
customer_reviews.text: I have all 6 of these in my dryer & my clothes were so staticy that they were stuck together & stuck to us. I have to use a dryer sheet to get rid of the static, so I am throwing these out. They don't do a darn thing other than make alot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: These wool dryer balls are great! They allow me to dry my clothes on a lower heat setting, and often, for less time. I like that I can easily incorporate additional perks into my laundry routine such as adding natural fragrance (essential oils), reducing fabric wrinkles, and fabric softening by simply throwing a small wool ball into the dryer with my clothes. And, I no longer have a need for dryer sheets or liquid fabric softener - YAY!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Kaits

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase! Low Energy and Waste-free
customer_reviews.text: These were a great investment as it replaces those one time dryer sheets. Bonus is that I am able to dry some clothes I used to hang dry now because I am able to put the dryer on low heat with these dryer balls and they dry really well and still quickly. It does not have that dryer sheet freshness smell, just a very simple and clean smell. Highly recommend buying. We didn't know how many to use so we use all 6 for a load and that's been just fine. One thing to note that isn't a big deal to use is that the balls will sometimes end up in your pant legs or sweater arm, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: They Are Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: I do not use very much fabric softener, mostly because many of the clothes I wash suggest you not use it. When I found these, I discovered that they do a terrific job of keeping the clothes moving around in the dryer and helps avoid clothes balling up. One thing I have noticed is there isn't very much static in my clothes. Now I've used them only in the summer when that isn't a major issue. The winter, where I live, is the time to test for the static problem. I've not tried using any essential oils on mine so I can't speak to how they freshen or scent my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: BLMofMI

customer_reviews.title: Bad dryer? Here's the fix!
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment building that has the worst dryers ever. Clothes come out 75 mins after being put in and are just as wet, but a little warmer, and they smell like stale smoke. I used these in the dryer last time I did laundry and I had dry clothes for the first time ever & no stale smoke smell!!! The wool balls get very slightly moist and are easily air dried. They never smell like anything except maybe fabric softener, which I don't use. So cheap and so convenient, they are impossible to pass up!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: THEY REALLY WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'VE BEEN USING THEM WITH GOOD SUCCESS, BUT TODAY I PUT THEM TO THE ULTIMATE TEST. I DRIED 2 COMPLETE KING SIZE SHEET SETS AND PUT 2 OF THESE DRYER BALLS IN WITH IT. I COULD NOT BELIEVE THE RESULTS! THE SHEETS WHERE COMPLETELY DRY AND THE MOST AMAZING THING.......WHERE NOT WADDED UP IN KNOTS. JUST LOOSELY AND SEPARATELY FROM EACH OTHER, COMPLETELY DRY AFTER ONE CYCLE! THEY MADE A BELIEVER OUT OF ME. I TRIED TENNISBALLS, BUT THEY MAKE SUCH A LOUD THUMPING NOISE.
customer_reviews.author: Imjusttellinthetruth

customer_reviews.title: not quite sure
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I've noticed an increase in static for all laundry loads that were done during the past week using this item. I did not notice any change in drying time either. I do appreciate that these are reusable and you can DIY scent the laundry to your liking but I don't think that trumps clingy clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dual benefit
customer_reviews.text: seem to work well... I also bought another brand and use them together so i cant provide a more specific opinion. in general all the wool balls are holding up. on a side note, my pit bull mix got a hold to one wayward ball that fell out of the dryer and he thought was meant for him. since he hot his goop all over it, I let him keep it and he loves playing with it. Ots has held up to his chewing better than tennis balls and he seem to enjoy it better than rubber balls.
customer_reviews.author: MishiMichell

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first..would these really work? I love them! I first used on a child's sleeping bag, I wasn't wanting the stuffing all wadded up...these work amazingly!! Ive used w towels and the drying time was actually cut by about 15 minutes..add the time up after a few loads and it save dryer/ electricity time. Yes, you do hear the balls bouncing in dryer but no more irritating than a zipper or a lost coin.
customer_reviews.author: S'grass

customer_reviews.title: pouch missing, balls are great
customer_reviews.text: the first time I bought this it came with a nice little pouch. Then I bought it again as a present, this time it came without the pouch, just wrapped in plastic. The balls themselves are great and I've been using them for a while now. I out a few drops of essential oil on them before I put them in the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: daniel wehr

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: These do absolutely nothing for static cling. You still have to waste money on harsh dryer sheets. If you're getting them just to aid in the drying process, they're alright, but don't get them to replace dryer sheets. I would go with a better brand that actually helps prevent static cling. So disappointed in that.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Van Donselaar

customer_reviews.title: Do not eliminate static but do keep linens seperated
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. They help keep things like blankets and sheets separated some so they dry better. However, I was worried about static, and I feel like these wool balls create more static than the clothes had to begin with. So I'm still using dryer sheets. My dryer has sensor dry and quits running when clothes are dry so I do not believe they cut down dry time. Not my favorite product! I'm trying to be more eco friendly, hoping these would eliminate dryer sheets. They missed the mark for me.
customer_reviews.author: Emily B6

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to plastic dryer tumblers.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because I did not want to add a hard plastic tumbler to my dryer. Was concerned about it being too loud but it they aren’t. I like using this instead of a chemical-soaked dryer sheet, but I’m not convinced it helps clothes dry any better. I feel like I had to run my loads slightly longer than usual. Otherwise good results, just don’t let them roll away into some dark, dusty corner of your basement or you may never want to use them again..
customer_reviews.author: 1000cranestoremember

customer_reviews.title: Stop using dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know about wrinkle free or scents (I don’t add oil or whatever) or freshness but I can say that other than my clothes no longer smelling specifically like a dryer sheet, I have noticed absolutely no difference by switching to these! Which is amazing because now I’m not creating garbage and this helps the absorbency of towels. My clothes aren’t super static-y and I have really enjoyed them. So many towels and blankets say to use tennis balls or whatever and these do that for everything!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: WOW What a Surprise
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend told me about these and truly I didn't believe her. She said that your drying time cuts in half and practically no wrinkles. I finally broke down and purchased them. OMG what a surprise. They truly do work. Towels dry in half the time and my clothes and sheets have not wrinkles. You don't need a dryer sheet either. I do put a couple of drops of essential oil on them to make the clothes have a nice scent. I love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Chestnutt

customer_reviews.title: Great little helpers in the dryer!
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile. And having 6 makes for options, use as many or few as needed per load. TIPS: I leave several unscented and several get a drop or two of lavender or orange essential oil for a fresh lift of scent in the dryer. I have a little basket on top of the dryer that I put them in after use so any potential dampness can evaporate better. You can also add a safety pin through to help with the extra static load in winter!
customer_reviews.author: chalklady

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand..
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use these but I don't understand the hype...I'm a normal washer of clothes, nothing too crazy... but I don't see that these help at all. Trying to understand if I'm somehow mis-using but I don't think it's possible...you just throw them in :) Hoping this will get better.
customer_reviews.author: db33

customer_reviews.title: 99% Sheep’s Wool 1% Human Hair
customer_reviews.text: Someone please tell me why there is human hair in my bag of organic wool balls. I pulled out two 3” brown human hair.. a few other coarse black hairs that I was able to convince myself those are probably the normal hairs you’d find mixed up w sheep’s wool... but the human hair is just.... geeeeeeez. I used the balls anyway. Just a few loads use so not much to write home about but I just had to let y’all know about the hair. I’m up past my bedtime losing sleep over it.
customer_reviews.author: 239Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.text: My teenage daughter has really long hair, and these help “collect” her hair as well as keeping the laundry from getting twisted up. We had the plastic ones before and they were SO LOUD! These are nice and quiet. Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise M. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.text: Where have these been all my life? They not only cut down drying time but also helped reduce the amount of wrinkles in my clothes. These are a great alternative to traditional dryer sheets and so much better for the environment. They came packaged nicely in a storage bag and were in perfect condition. Would recommend for anyone looking to save some money and do a little bit to help save the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie W

customer_reviews.title: Static static static
customer_reviews.text: Even with using all 8 balls in the dryer at the same time, there is so much static! Update: these dryer balls get worse with every use! They’re unusable after only having them for less than 2 months. I’ve had wool balls that lasted over a year without static. I’m going back to them and paying the extra.
customer_reviews.author: AAO

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: This product works ok. It definitely does not keep the static away like a dryer sheet, tho. I make sure to dry my clothes a little less. This product does not work if you over dry your items. It is unscented which is one of the reasons I bought them. Also note, these are truly XL measuring in about the size of a baseball. They also sound loud as they tumble in the dryer due to their size and weight. I use them, but probably would not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary and Rocket

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I put a drop of lavender oil on each ball before tossing them into the dryer. Makes my house smell great and my clothes feel softer. Most of the reviews talk about how dryer balls don't make clothes as soft as dryer sheets. I just have to say duh! They are not supposed to. The point is I can't have "natural fragrance" as unnatural as it is I am allergic to it. These dryer balls are better than nothing and the lavender essential oil helps. My clothes are definitely wrinkle free and softer than if I had used nothing at all!
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: They really work. Ingenious product.
customer_reviews.text: These miraculous little guys work as advertised and have allowed me to stop using fabric softeners, which I never liked, owing to the oily feel they can lead to. I rated 5 stars for everything, including “scent” because they have no scent—a good thing. Excellent example of how, with a little ingenuity, we can all become more socially responsible in protecting our natural resources, while winning in other ways also.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Simple, inexpensive, dryer solution
customer_reviews.text: These balls not only help prevent wrinkles in your cloths, but help assure even drying (by preventing cloths from bundling up). You might still want to put a dryer sheet in if you want a scent to your freshly washed cloths, or find static an issue in your area... If you haven't ever used these, at this price you can't possible have an excuse not to try...
customer_reviews.author: - Taz -

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I am no longer going to be using dryer sheets! These wool dryer balls are amazing! I did dry a load of laundry with 3 wool dryer balls and when I pulled it out it was staticy. I had to dry a second load and I put a safety pin through the dryer ball and this load didn't have any static at all. I highly recommend these if you're wanting to ditch the dryer sheets!
customer_reviews.author: lynn valentine

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love these
customer_reviews.text: I have an older dryer and have had some issues with drying time. After getting these dryer balls my first load I tried them on was a load of bath towel. I couldn't believe how much quicker they dried. Shaved 20 minutes off my regular drying time and the towels are so soft. I am anxious to try some lavender oil on them as the company suggested but even right out of the neat little bag they came in, everything smells so fresh. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Cox

product_meta.title: SnugPad Wool Dryer Balls XL Size 6 Pack, Natural Fabric Softener 100% Organic Premium New Zealand Wool, Chemical Free and Reduces Wrinkles, 1000+ Loads, Baby Safe, Saving Energy & Time, White 6 Count
product_meta.description:
Size:6 Count (Pack of 1)

Make laundry time more efficient Stop wasting your money on one-time use products like liquid fabric softeners and dryer sheets.

 * Dryer sheets can leave chemical-residue inside your dryer, forcing you to keep up with maintenance on your drying machine.

Did you know that many dryer manufacturers recommend NOT using sheets?

 * Our SnugPad Wool Dryer balls are 100% and a great natural alternative for dryer sheets, liquid fabric softeners, and plastic dryer balls.
 * They soften and fluff your clothing, towels, sheets, blankets, jackets, and more.
 * They're much safer than commercial grade fabric softeners and dryer sheets that can contain dangerous chemicals for babies and pets.
 * Healthier, and Energy-efficient.

 * Pleasant scent and finish- Leaves your clothes soft and great-smelling. 

 * Saves you time and money- the wool dryer balls can shorten drying time to up to 25%

 * Re-usable- Lasts over 1,000 loads. Usable for up to a year (maybe even more)! 

 * Made with high quality- New Zealand Wool - No chemicals or fillers.

 *  Pair it with scented oils for a fresh smell- Lavender, orange, lemon, tea tree, and other essential oils pair great with the dryer balls.
feature_bullets: ECO-FRIENDLY: Snug Pads Wool Dryer balls are an eco-friendly alternative to plastic dryer balls that are most frequently seen on television!
REDUCES WRINKLES AND LINT: The wool balls' natural anti-static quality will help reduce your need to iron your clothes.

REUSABLE UP TO FOUR YEARS: Our dryer balls will last over a thousand loads, allowing you to save money on dryer sheets and fabric softeners. SnugPad wool balls can be used on any load white, colored, and dark clothes, towels, sheets, and more.
SAVE ELECTRICITY: Your appliance usage will shrink as you see your clothes dry up to 25% faster. Re-usable- Lasts over 1,000 loads, equal to 4 large boxes of dryer sheets.
HANDMADE AND CHEMICAL FREE: Perfect for Sensitive Skin and Babies. Keep your family healthy and safe.
COMPETITIVE PRICE for premium quality wool dryer balls. SNUGPAD is American owned & operated. All products ship from the United States. The BEST choice for smart consumers.
ALL NATURAL AND ORGANIC: 100% Premium New Zealand Wool Dryer Balls with NO FILLERS! Chemical free alternative to using dryer sheets.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
